QuestionJSON.Question: Tiger has been studying the Islamic Golden Age and its scientific advancements, particularly the invention of the astrolabe. The astrolabe, a device used to solve problems related to time and the position of the stars, has multiple rotating parts each playing a specific role. Similarly, a computer also has many internal and external parts that function together to form a system. Which part of the computer is similar to the rotating parts of the astrolabe that use data to solve calculations?
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The Central Processing Unit (CPU), similar to the rotating parts of the astrolabe, performs most calculations within a computer. Like how the rotating parts of the astrolabe use data to solve calculations, the CPU processes instructions to solve tasks.
